EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.97}.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global minimum heat value is {0.17}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Maritime on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Maritime on the x-axis is {0.94}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value for label Technology on the y-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value for Technology on the y-axis is {0.95}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Cost on the y-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Cost on the y-axis is {0.69}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Air and Speed or the cell corresponding to Intermodal and Technology?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Intermodal} and {Technology} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Warehousing and Sustainability or the cell corresponding to Road and Technology?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Road} and {Technology} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Road and Speed or the cell corresponding to Tracking and Sustainability?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Road} and {Speed} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Warehousing and Cost or the cell corresponding to Maritime and Technology?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Warehousing} and {Cost} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.37 to 0.46?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Last Mile, Capacity), (Intermodal, Compliance), (Customs, Cost), (Air, Efficiency), (Warehousing, Speed), (Tracking, Sustainability), (Road, Technology)}.
